title: cant run 60fps at all
body:
hello everyone i recently built a new pc 

Intel i7 6700k
msi z170a gaming m7
msi gtx 1070
corsair vengeance LPX 2x8g

monitor is
Samsung U28E590D 28-Inch UHD LED-Lit Monitor
using displayport

for some reason i cant not get 60fps at all. even if i lower my resolution to 1080 and put my quality to medium i can not for the life of me figure out why i cant get a steady 60fps. yes vsync is off in my ingame settings and video card. this and world of warcraft are the only 2 games that im having trouble with. i can play kotk, fallout4, csgo, dead by daylight, dying light, and battlefield 4 run smooth as butta just to name a few. but i cant not figure out why i cant run league or wow in a decent resolution and at high graphics. any help would be much appreciated 

ps i wont be able to reply to anyone till tomrrow night around 7pst but i will try all suggestions that are left in the comments and respond with the results thanks.

replies.body: Having a resolution high than 1080 can cause you to run into some issues, so it may be necessary to reduce it even if using a larger monitor.  Aside from that there just may be general maintenance required, like making sure your drivers are updated, to get things running smoothly again.  I recommend running through the steps in the [FPS issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting) guide to make sure your PC is tuned up.  I hope that helps!
ive done everything on that list and still nothing
